info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 5 at 8:20AM CDT until June 6 at 7:08AM CDT by NWS Wichita KS
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kansas...
Arkansas River at Arkansas City affecting Cowley County.
Arkansas River at Oxford affecting Sumner County.
Cottonwood River at Cottonwood Falls affecting Chase County.
Walnut River at Winfield affecting Butler and Cowley Counties.
Whitewater River at Augusta affecting Butler and Cowley Counties.
Whitewater River at Towanda affecting Butler County.
Neosho River near Chanute affecting Allen and Neosho Counties.
Neosho River at Iola affecting Allen County.
Walnut River at Arkansas City affecting Cowley County.
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kansas...
Cottonwood River near Plymouth affecting Chase and Lyon Counties.
Neosho River at Oswego affecting Cherokee and Labette Counties.
Neosho River near Parsons affecting Labette and Neosho Counties.
Neosho River near Erie affecting Neosho County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Whitewater River at Augusta.
* WHEN...Until tomorrow morning.
* IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Flood waters begin to flow over Southwest 70th Street just east of the river bridge located 3 miles northwest of Augusta and flows across Southwest 60th Street near the river bridge located about 4 miles northwest of town.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 24.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 5.4 feet Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet.
info.instruction:
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don't drown.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 215 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING
